of his ignorant wonder, & has opened as it
were the doors of the mysteries of nature
had already ap been per brought to great
perfection. Metaphysics Metaphysics the
science of mans intimate nature, & logic,
or the grammar & elementary principles of
latter
that science, recieved from the philosophers
of the Periclean age a firm basis.
built
All our more exact philosophy is founded
upon
on the labours of these great men, & the
many of the
very words which we employ in metaphiscal
-phiscal distinctions were invented by them
to give accuracy & system to their
reasonings. - Their moral The science
of morals, or the voluntary conduct of
men in relation to themselves or others,
dates from this epoch. How inexpressibly
bolder, & more pure were the doctrines
